Signal Explanations.fifo_rx_f_empty: indicator signal that shows if the FIFO receiver is empty
Signal Explanations.RX_EMPTY: output signal representing the empty status of the FIFO receiver

Logical Operators Explanation.|->: an overlapping implication operator meaning that if the conditions on the left are met then the condition on the right must hold SINCE THE SAME CLOCK CYCLE

Assertion 1.Assertion Explaination: if the FIFO receiver empty indicator equals 1 then the FIFO receiver empty output equals 1 SINCE THE SAME CLOCK CYCLE

Signal Explanations.DATA_CONFIG_REG[1]: the second bit (bit 1) of the configuration register

Logical Operators Explanation.|->: an overlapping implication operator meaning that if the conditions on the left are met then the condition on the right must hold SINCE THE SAME CLOCK CYCLE

Assertion 5.Assertion Explaination: if the second bit of the configuration register equals 0 then the error signal equals 0 SINCE THE SAME CLOCK CYCLE

Signal Explanations.DATA_CONFIG_REG[0]: the first bit (bit 0) of the configuration register

Assertion 6.Assertion Explaination: if the first bit of the configuration register equals 0 then the error signal equals 0 SINCE THE SAME CLOCK CYCLE

Signal Explanations.DATA_CONFIG_REG[0]: the first bit (bit 0) of the configuration register
Signal Explanations.DATA_CONFIG_REG[1]: the second bit (bit 1) of the configuration register

Logical Operators Explanation.|->: an overlapping implication operator meaning that if the conditions on the left are met then the condition on the right must hold SINCE THE SAME CLOCK CYCLE

Assertion 7.Assertion Explaination: if the first bit of the configuration register equals 1 and the second bit of the configuration register equals 1 then the error signal equals 1 SINCE THE SAME CLOCK CYCLE
